pros: ETO with each paycheck(biweekly), which is 10 hours a month

review_title: It is what you make it.
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: Offers supervision for licensure with a fair contract to work as payment. Provides CEUs for free. Several opportunities for advancement.
cons: Revolving door of employment. Poor salary for LPC. School staff make the rules.

pros: Hours, great co-workers, proximity to things in town.
cons: Poor pay, poor mgmt, not a liveable wage.

pros: Good Health Benefits and Good Hours depending on the job.
cons: Upper Management is terrible. Policy and procedures aren't followed all the time. Exceptions are made with friends. Management is terrible at communicating and it's a lot of" pettiness". The pay is not a livable wage, people with college degrees are making almost minimum wage. Raises have been paused for about two years.

pros: It’s okay and holds while you look for other jobs
cons: Bad pay, unreliable staff, bad job

review_title: Not for people who like balance
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: You get experience working with IDD patients
cons: the work schedule is all over the place. They expect you to do things that are not in your job description. They make you buy the highest liability insurance even though you do not drive clients in your car.

review_title: Good place to start mental health career
job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: Able to move up with more education. Encouraged to continue education.
cons: Pay is not great compared to other agencies.

review_title: Great place to start your career
job_title: Clinician, Social Work/Mental Health in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: Plenty of learning opportunities, Fundamental skills to put your knowledge to applicable practice.

Even though there is not much room for advancement with this company, I enjoyed my co-workers and other staff I came in contact with. Also the insurance, paid time off, and community settings were a plus.
cons: As with other mental health facilities, this was a very stressful job at times. However, if the staff received more support from management, it would be a lot better. In addition, there is no room for advancement, minimum pay, and large caseloads.

review_title: Can only go up from where they were
pros:
Working with the clients was a positive experience. 
Good time off.
cons: Poorly managed and could not get the resources needed to assist with clients basic safety needs. Minimal time spent mentoring and more time spent making sure everything looked good on paper.

pros: Its a job, health benefits, its a job, it's a job, it's a job
cons: Racist and I mean in your face racist no promotional opportunities for blacks or women unless the boss went to high school with you or knows your family, will only promote friends, white people, family or someone they would like to or have slept with.

job_title: Community Service Support in Hattiesburg, MS

pros: The clients are the reason you get up and go to work in the morning.
Coworkers are great. Lots of opportunities for certifications.
cons: Management will increase your workload without a conversation of increasing salary. Not a great place if you enjoy work and home life balance. Expectations are high, but communication with management is extremely difficult since they rarely respond timely to emails or messages.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: A pay check and I only gave one star because I could not submit without it
cons: This company only cares about money. They do not care about the clients or getting them help. The management especially Mona the Children's Director is horrible and disrespectful to everyone she degrades and belittles the staff. They are all shady and undermined.

job_title: School Based Children's Clinician in Laurel, MS
pros: Benefits, work schedule, work place environment
cons: A lot of paperwork, stress level at times due to case load.
